Articles.Content:
Recently when playing KSP, I have been having this very frustrating problem.

I am really not sure how to fix it and if anyone has any suggestions I would be really grateful.

(This also only happens in KSP so I am 100% sure that my  graphics card isn't a problem, it is a GTX 1060)

Thank you

 

Video of the problem

Hi, I have the same problem - annoying shadow flickering.

I tried:
- change my resolution 2560/1440
- change vertical sync
- change fps limit
- install and uninstall graphic mods. To clarify, the shadow problem appears in a clean KSP without mods
- change fullscreen / window
- use the -force-d3d11 launch option
- reinstall the game
- use geforce experience optimal settings. I have - rtx 2060 super
- just turn off the shadows and it kind of works, fixes big black lines, but leaves shadows flickering. It's on the my video

My "shadow flickering" issue video

Just reporting the same problem here.

Totally fresh install of KSP with no mods. I also have a clean install of the latest Nvidia driver with its default settings.

Private Division tech support informed me they have seen this problem before on Nvidia GPUs but they don't as yet have a fix.

My card is  GTX 1070 TI. I can see that others have RTX series cards with the same issue, so it isn't a GPU hardware based issue. Guys what are your other system specs?

I've reported this problem over on the KSP issue tracker - issue 25992 - I suggest you visit the page and vote it up, add your own pictures, logs, system specs etc.

Until this is resolved I'll not be playing the game as it's too distracting.

Edited August 25, 2020 by rextable
additional info added
My card is a GTX 1060 6GB

Chaps - I've found a temporary solution. 

The latest version of Scatterer has a fix for the very issue described in this thread. Downloading and installing that mod fixes the shadow flickering completely, and you get lovely atmospheric scattering to boot. Obviously this isn't a solution for those who wish to play the game completely stock but for those of us who can't live with this bug, Scatterer is pretty much mandatory for the time being.

x

Heres the fix to this problem:

In the settings.cfg file find these settings and make sure they all = 1.

SHADOWS_FLIGHT_PROJECTION = 1
SHADOWS_KSC_PROJECTION = 1
SHADOWS_TRACKING_PROJECTION = 1
SHADOWS_EDITORS_PROJECTION = 1
SHADOWS_MAIN_PROJECTION = 1
SHADOWS_DEFAULT_PROJECTION = 1
